entry.title: #雅思# #口语# 不同说法--破产
entry.content:
Broke

I am broke.
I am so broke.
I’m flat broke.

Broken adj. 心灰意冷，颓废的
He was a broken man after his wife died. 妻子死后他成了个颓废的人。

Bankrupt

形容公司，企业或个人比较正式的破产
Bankruptcy n. 破产的状况
Go bankrupt/declare bankruptcy
口语化的表达

Go under 破产，倒闭
Go belly-up 破产，失败

Chapter 11: 破产法第11章

在美国社会的特殊表达法
Forever 21 filed for chapter 11. Forever 21 申请破产。

Run out of money

钱用完
I’m running out of money. 我的钱快用完了。
I have run out of money. 我的钱已经用光了。

Tapped out

没钱的
I’m pretty tapped out after the holiday.
过完这个假期我就彻底没钱了。
不能说money tapped out.

Cleaned out

表示把钱花光，用完
Casino cleaned me out. 我在赌场把钱输光了。

Bank account

My bank account is not very happy.
Bank account dried up.
银行账户枯竭。

Penniless

一贫如洗的
She fell in love with a penniless artist.
她爱上了一个一贫如洗的画家。

欠债

Debt 借款，欠债
Credit debt 信用贷款
In debt up to my eyeballs 负债累累

Payday loan 发薪日贷款
以个人信用为担保，承诺在发薪水后立马偿还

Loan shark 高利贷者
Keep away from that guy. He is just a loan shark.
离那人远点，他是个放高利贷的

Savings

Checking account 活期账户，可随时存取，没有次数限制，但利息很低
Savings account 储蓄账户，存取次数有限制，但可获得较高固定利息的收入

Save up 储蓄
She’s saving up for a new bike. 她正在存钱，想买一辆自行车。

Rainy day fund

雨天基金，应急基金
A rainy day fund should cover about three months of income.
应急基金应该得有三个月左右的收入

雨天指代困难时期，也可以指emergency fund

entry.title: #雅思# #口语# 不同说法--节俭
entry.content:
Thrifty adj. 节俭的

the careful use of money, especially by avoiding waste
Thrifty lodge 价格非常便宜的旅馆

Economical

Not using a lot of fuel, money…
You should buy ordinary everyday foodstuffs in bulk – it’s more economical

Pinch pennies

To spend as little money as possible
When we were first married, we had to pinch pennies just to get by.
我们刚结婚那会儿，得省着点过日子。

Price-conscious

Knowing how much things cost and avoiding buying expensive things.
Price=conscious shoppers

entry.title: #雅思# #口语# 不同说法--花钱/血拼
entry.content:
Spree/spri/(n.)

过分的玩乐,短暂的 放纵
a shopping spree 购物上短暂的放纵引申为买买买
Let's go on a shopping spree
go on a shopping spree
去疯狂购物
go on a spending spree
去痛快地花一笔
go on a drinking spree
去痛快地喝一通
Me too! Let’s go on a shopping spree! Shop till we drop!
我也很高兴呀！咱们买买买起来！不尽兴不罢休！

Shop till we drop

shop till sb drop (s）
We’re going to shop till we drop.
咱们要逛到腿软！

Okay. But 'm on a budget, remember? I can't pay through the nose for one outfit
好的，不过我预算有限，你知道的，一套衣服不能花太多钱。

budget(n.)预算

sb+be 动词+ on budget 某人需要控制开支
It's all right. We can look for something that won't break the bank.
没事，咱们可以看看不那么贵的。

break the bank

使银行破产引申为花费太多钱
not break the bank
不会花费太多钱

entry.title: #雅思# #口语# 不同说法--尽最大努力
entry.content:
bring your A game

Perform to the best of your ability.
But you better bring your A game.
不过你最好使出浑身解数。

take/give someone's best shot

To put one's utmost energy, effort, or determination into doing something.
And there she went off to take her best shot with Mr. Big.
她使出浑身解数勾引大人物。

pull out all the stops

to do everything you can to make something successful
Gaby was willing to pull out all the stops.
加布愿意使出浑身解数。

throw everything

Landry is going to throw everything he can.
兰德里会使出浑身解数。

make every effort

She had made every effort to attract him, but he had not given her his heart.
她使出浑身解数吸引他，但他没有把心交给她。

do my best

I'll do my best with the Archbishop with an added spring in my step.
我会使出浑身解数 伺候好大主教。

crank up

To crank something up means to increase it or make it more intense.
She must have cranked it up to 11.
她一定使出了浑身解数。

entry.title: #雅思# #口语# 不同说法--好笑
entry.content:
That cracks me up.

这让我哈哈大笑。
动词搭配“crack someone up”常用于口语会话中，意思是“让某人捧腹大笑”。
That movie cracked me up. I cracked up.
这部电影让我大笑不止。我破声大笑。

It’s priceless.

这太好笑了。
形容词“priceless”在这里的意思并不是“贵重的、无价的”，而是形容某件事“极其好笑”。

It’s hilarious.

这真好笑。
形容词“hilarious”的意思是“非常好笑的，引人大笑的”。

It killed me.

这让我捧腹大笑。
动词“kill”在这里的意思并不是“杀死”，而是说一件事“非常有趣”，让人大笑不止。

It’s side-splitting.

这真是太好笑了！这真是让人笑得前仰后合！
形容词“side-splitting”用来形容“极为有趣的，让人笑得合不拢嘴”的人或事情。

entry.title: #雅思# #口语# 不同说法--boring
entry.content:
Dull

The film is dull
That film was really dull as dishwater

Tedious

Too long, slow and boring
My commute is so tedious

Dry

Boring and serious
This book is really dry.
The conversation was really dry.

Monotonous

Boring and lacking in variety

Humdrum

Boring because nothing changes
A town/city/village could be humdrum. 无趣的
I’ve moved to a really humdrum town in Wales.

Mind numbing

very boring

bland

boring because it has no flavour
my cooking is definitely not bland.

Mundane

Boring and lacks excitement

Dreary

Boring in a depressing way
Weather could be dreary, if it is raining a little bit
The weather is really dreary
He lived a very dreary life.

Drab

Boring and lacking in colour
That outfit is a bit drab. I think we need a bit of colour.

Forgettable

Easily forgotten because it is boring/lacking excitement
I went to a play the other day and it was entirely forgettable.

Watch paint dry

idiom
That football match was like watching paint dry.
I’d rather watch paint dry.

entry.title: #雅思# #口语# 不同说法--堵车
entry.content:
堵车的表达

Be backed up 车辆堵塞，排成长龙

The traffic is/was backed up. 交通堵塞
Traffic was back up this morning. 早上堵车了
The traffic was backed up for six kilometres on the road to the coast.
交通堵塞长达六公里，一直堵到海边。

Be congested

The roads were so congested. 交通堵塞

Sb. Be caught in traffic
I am caught in some brutal traffic. Can I reschedule?
我这儿堵车了，我能再约个时间吗？
There is/was a ton of traffic.

堵车以后的情况

Be stuck
I’m stuck in traffic.
There are traffic jams everywhere.
It is rush hour now.
The traffic was murder this morning.
I’m held up in traffic.
Traffic is moving at a snail’s pace.

Bumper to bumper 一辆接一辆
Bumper 汽车保险杠
The traffic was bumper to bumper. 交通非常拥堵，车子一辆接一辆的。

Drive on the shoulder
Shoulder n. 紧急停车道
公路两侧供车辆停靠的地带
One guy even tried to drive on the shoulder. 有个人甚至想开到紧急停车道上。
Sb have/has to take the bridge and that was worse
I had to take the bridge and that was worse

Stop-and-go adj. 走走停停的
I was half an hour late because of the stop-and-go traffic.
Start and stop 走走停停
Can you not start and stop so much?
Leave a little space 拉开距离

Sb. Be getting carsick/seasick/airsick
Well, I am sorry, but I’m getting carsick.

Wit n. 头脑，
Be at one’s wit’ end 头脑的尽头，引申为没有办法
I was at my wits’ end, but quite relieved after I got past all that nonsense.
I’m at my wits’ end. I don’t know how to help him.

超车

Cut in front of sb. 超某人的车，抢某人的道
Cut in on sb. 超车
Did you see that white car cut in on us? 你看到那辆抢超我们的白色汽车了吗？
Cut sb. Up
A car cut me up several times this morning. 今天早上有辆车抢我好几次道。

entry.title: #读书笔记# Animal Farm
entry.content:
About this book
这本书由英国著名作家George Orwell所著，1945年于英国首次出版。从文体上来看，这是一本寓言小说，反映了1917年俄国革命至斯大林时期的历史故事。《时代杂志》将这本书评选为1923-2005年100佳英文小说。

About the author
George Orwell是著名小说家、记者和社会评论家。他以其敏锐的洞察力和犀利的文笔审视和记录着他所生活的那个时代。

故事开始于英格兰威灵顿的一个农场，由于原主人琼斯先生管理不善，激起了农场内动物的造反之意。在一头老公猪“少校”的指领下，小动物们进行了造反并且成功了。老少校死后，农场主要由其它两头公猪领导着，分别是雪球和拿破仑。一开始，他们和农场的其它小动物严格遵守着【动物主义七戒】，大家一起努力，建设着理想中的农场。后来建设美好家园的列车却越来越朝着相反的方向驶去。【七戒】不断被修改，直到最后谁都不记得曾经的是什么了。

我的感想
一月份的时候我就看完了这本书，又是停了这么久才开始写写自己的想法。这次动笔时间晚，最主要的原因是，想法太多，但是又太杂乱，不知道如何说起。读的时候想到了很多，政府，权力，人民，洗脑，历史，等等，等等。如果全部都聊一遍的话，将会是一个浩大的工程，而且，感觉我目前的知识储备也无法支持我对这些话题侃侃而谈，简单针对单个问题发表批判性的言论的话，连我自己都知道那将会是多么的肤浅，所以不打算进行任何的批评，只是想针对其中的某些片段结合我自己的感受聊一聊。

全部写完以后，发现有点不是很合适放在这里，就决定只展示一部分的笔记，至少证明我看过我写过，剩下的笔记就先躺在我的icloud里吧，以后有机会了再展示。

entry.title: #雅思# #口语# 不同说法--最好的/比别人好
entry.content:
top-notch
Something else 出色的人或者物
I’ve seen some fine singers, but she is something else.
Tower above … 超过
Her music towers above others.
Off the chart 处于极高水平的
I am telling you, her music is off the chart.

entry.title: #雅思# #口语# 不同说法--擅长/不擅长
entry.content:
一般提到了擅长做什么，打开第一反应就是good at, 但是，还有其它的表达方式是我们可以参考的

擅长

proficient

I am proficient in…

experience

I have extensive experience in…

expert

An expert at doing/on

Dab hand

Savvy

。。。person

Well, I’m a people person.
我是个善于交际的人。
people person喜欢/擅长交际的人 ^ I'm good with people.
我是个善于交际的人。

natural

(n.)天生具有...才能的人，有...天赋的人
You're a natural.
你真是个天才。

sb be a natural for sth.
某人天生适合某事。/某人是...的最佳人 选。
He is a natural for the role.
他是这个角色的最佳人选。

natural
(adj.)天生具有某种能力的，天赋的
Jack is a natural leader.
=Jack is a born leader.
Jack天生是个领导。 sb be born to do / be sth.

某人天生适合做某事/从事某项活动。
My sister is born to be an artist.
我妹妹天生是个画家啊。

不擅长

lousy

(adj.)糟糕的，不擅长的
我不太擅长于打网球。

bad

be bad at doing sth
不擅长做某事
I'm very bad at cooking.
我的厨艺很差。
